intro: Cacalia teretifolia, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Cacalia teretifolia is also known for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Cacalia.
